doc.ContractDescription: IN CONTRAST TO THE DRAMATIC DECLINES IN ARCTIC SEA ICE EXTENT, ANTARCTIC SEA ICE HAS SEEN A MODEST INCREASE IN EXTENT OVER THE PAST 30 YEARS, IN STARK CONTRAST TO MODEL PREDICTIONS. THIS OVERALL TREND, HOWEVER, OBSCURES STRONG REGIONAL TRENDS THAT RIVAL THOSE IN THE ARCTIC. THE CAUSES AND CONSEQUENCES OF THESE CHANGES REMAIN POORLY UNDERSTOOD. MOREOVER, WHILE DECLINES IN ARCTIC SEA ICE AGE AND THICKNESS HAVE BEEN OBSERVED OVER THE PAST DECADE, WE HAVE NO COMPARABLE INFORMATION FOR THE ANTARCTIC. RECENT MODEL RESULTS SUGGEST THAT CHANGES IN ICE THICKNESS (DUE TO ENHANCED DEFORMATION) HAVE BEEN GREATER THAN CHANGES IN EXTENT. THE PAUCITY OF IN SITU DATA HAS HAMPERED DETERMINATION OF EVEN THE CLIMATOLOGICAL MEAN DISTRIBUTION OF ICE THICKNESS. SATELLITE ESTIMATES OF ICE THICKNESS ARE AT PRESENT UNCERTAIN, OWING TO THE DEEP SNOW COVER OVER MUCH OF THE ICE-COVERED AREA, REQUIRING AN INDEPENDENT ESTIMATION OF SNOW DEPTH. THE PREVAILING VIEW OF THE ANTARCTIC SEA ICE COVER IS THAT IT IS THIN, BASED ON AVAILABLE IN SITU DATA. RECENT IN SITU, ICESAT AND ICEBRIDGE FREEBOARD AND SNOW DEPTH DATA INDICATE THAT SEA ICE THICKNESS IN THE DIFFICULT TO ACCESS INTERIOR REGIONS OF THE ICE PACK ARE SIGNIFICANTLY THICKER, WITH OFTEN DEEPER SNOW COVER, INDICATING A SIGNIFICANT BIAS IN EXISTING IN SITU ASSESSMENTS. THIS THICK ICE IS FORMED THROUGH HEAVY DEFORMATION AND DEEP SNOW ACCUMULATION. WHILE THICKNESS VARIABILITY IN THE THINNER, OUTER PACK IS MINIMAL, LIKE THE OBSERVED CHANGES IN THICK MULTIYEAR ICE IN THE ARCTIC, ICE THICKNESS CHANGES WILL BE MOST APPARENT IN THE DISTRIBUTION OF THIS THICK ICE. WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE A ROBUST ASSESSMENT OF ANTARCTIC SNOW AND ICE THICKNESS DISTRIBUTION, FOCUSSING ON THESE AREAS OF THICKER ICE USING A NOVEL COMBINATION OF COINCIDENT ICEBRIDGE (OIB) SNOW RADAR, LIDAR, AND DIGITAL IMAGERY, AND ICESAT LASER ALTIMETRY. WE WILL EXAMINE THE FOLLOWING KEY HYPOTHESES: (1) MUCH OF THE ANTARCTIC SEA ICE COVER IS MUCH THICKER THAN IS SUGGESTED BY IN SITU OBSERVATIONS, PARTICULARLY BY SPRING, (2) THIS THICKER ICE IS HEAVILY DEFORMED AND/OR HAS DEEP, COMPLEX SNOW COVER. FREEBOARDS AND SURFACE ROUGHNESS CAN PROVIDE REASONABLE ICE THICKNESS ESTIMATES AND SNOW DEPTHS FROM LASER ALTIMETRY ALONE, AND (3) INTERANNUAL VARIABILITY IN EXTENT AND THICKNESS OF THIS ICE IS DETECTABLE AND CAN BE RELATED TO INTERANNUAL VARIATIONS IN SEASONAL ATMOSPHERIC FORCING. THIS WORK WILL (1) DEVELOP AN IMPROVED SNOW DEPTH WITH ROBUST ERROR BOUNDS RECORD OVER ANTARCTIC SEA ICE FROM OIB DATA, (2) DEVELOP THE FIRST ESTIMATE OF ICE THICKNESS FROM OIB DATA, (3) CALCULATE THE EXTENT AND THICKNESS OF THICK ANTARCTIC SEA ICE FOR THE ENTIRE ICESAT PERIOD OF 2003-2009, USING AN IMPROVED ALGORITHM GUIDED BY OIB DATA THAT AVOIDS THE NEED FOR ASSUMPTIONS ABOUT SNOW DEPTH, AND (4) USING REANALYSIS WINDS, PRECIPITATION AND SATELLITE ICE DRIFT, EXAMINE THE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THICK ICE DISTRIBUTION AND ATMOSPHERIC FORCING DRIVING ITS SEASONAL EVOLUTION IN KEY REGIONS OF RAPID CHANGE AROUND COASTAL ANTARCTICA. THIS ANALYSIS WILL PROVIDE AN IMPROVED RECORD OF SEA ICE THICKNESS AND ITS VARIABILITY, WITH ROBUST ERROR BOUNDS, AND FOR THE FIRST TIME, AN OBSERVATIONAL EVALUATION OF THE DRIVERS OF ICE THICKNESS VARIABILITY IN THE ANTARCTIC. THROUGH COMPARISON OF OIB AND ICESAT DATA, WE WILL DETERMINE POTENTIAL SPATIAL AND SAMPLING BIASES IN THE EXISTING IN SITU RECORD OF ANTARCTIC SEA ICE THICKNESS. THIS ADDRESSES SEVERAL KEY OBJECTIVES OF THE NRA, INCLUDING IMPROVING THE UTILITY OF ICEBRIDGE DATA TO ESTIMATE SNOW ACCUMULATION ON SEA ICE, AND IMPROVING THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE MECHANISMS CONTROLLING THE SEA ICE COVER INCLUDING QUANTIFICATION OF THE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN SEA ICE AND THE OCEAN AND ATMOSPHERE. THIS WORK WILL LEAD TO IMPROVED ALGORITHMS FOR ICESAT-2 AND A NEW SEA ICE VARIABLE WITH WHICH TO EVALUATE ANTARCTIC ICE-CLIMATE INTERACTIONS, WITH THE EVENTUAL AIM TO FURTHER ELUCIDATE THE CAUSES AND CONSEQUENCES OF RECENT, SURPRISING TRENDS IN ANTARCTIC SEA ICE
doc.MajorAgency: RECONCILING ANTARCTIC SEA ICE THICKNESS AND SNOW D

doc.ContractDescription: GAMMA-RAY BURSTS: PROGENITORS TO PROBES IN A MANNER REMINISCENT OF QUASARS AND TYPE IA SUPERNOVAE, THE STUDY OF LONG-DURATION GAMMA-RAY BURSTS (LGRBS) IS INTENSELY FOCUSED ON TWO CRITICAL PATHS: (I) UNDERSTANDING THE PROGENITORS AND DETAILED NATURE OF THESE CATACLYSMIC EXPLOSIONS, AND (II) USING THEM AS PROBES OF THE DISTANT UNIVERSE. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO UTILIZE DATA FROM SEVERAL NASA MISSIONS (HUBBLE, SPITZER, SWIFT) TO ADDRESS AND ADVANCE BOTH ASPECTS OF LGRB RESEARCH. IN PARTICULAR, WE WILL UTILIZE EXISTING AFTERGLOW OBSERVATIONS FROM SWIFT/UVOT (SUPPLEMENTED BY SOME GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONS) TO PRECISELY LOCATE LGRBS WITHIN THEIR HOST GALAXIES IN HUBBLE SPACE TELESCOPE IMAGES, BOTH IN RELATION TO THEIR HOST CENTERS (OFFSETS) AND TO THE UNDERLYING REST-FRAME ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT DISTRIBUTION (STAR FORMATION). THIS INFORMATION, IN COMPARISON TO EXISTING STUDIES OFVARIOUS SUPERNOVA EXPLOSIONS AND SHORT GRBS, WILL SHED LIGHT ON THE NATURE OF THE PROGENITORS AND THE TYPES OF ENVIRONMENTS THAT SUPPORT THEIR FORMATION. THE EXISTING DATA WILL ALLOW US TO EXPAND ON WORK FROM THE PRE-SWIFT ERA BY A FACTOR OF ABOUT 3-5, AND WILL ALSO ALLOW TO EXPLORE ANY REDSHIFT EVOLUTION IN THE NATURE OF THE PROGENITORS. IN ADDITION, WE WILL COMBINE THE HOST GALAXY REST-FRAME UV AND OPTICAL MEASUREMENTS FROM HUBBLE AND SPITZER, RESPECTIVELY, WITH EXISTING METALLICITY MEASUREMENTS FROM LGRB AFTERGLOW SPECTROSCOPY TO STUDY THE MASS-METALLICITY AND MASS-METALLICITY-SFR RELATIONS AT REDSHIFTS OF Z~2-5, A RANGE THAT IT LARGELY INACCESSIBLE TO DIRECT GALAXY METALLICITY STUDIES. THIS STUDY WILL ADVANCE OUR KNOWLEDGE OF THE EVOLUTION OF THE MASS-METALLICITY RELATION TO Z~5, AND WILL PROVIDE FUNDAMENTAL INSIGHT ON THE ENRICHMENT HISTORY OF GALAXIES. FINALLY, WE WILL COMBINED THE LGRB RADIAL OFFSET AND METALLICITY MEASUREMENTS TO EXPLORE THE MEAN METALLICITY GRADIENT OF STAR FORMING GALAXIES AT Z~2-5. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE DATA FOR OVER 80 SWIFT LGRBS, WITH 480 HST ORBITS (ACS AND WFC3) AND 350 HOURS WITH SPITZER/IRAC.

doc.ContractDescription: SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 2001, THE ATOMDB HAS BECOME THE STANDARD REPOSITORY FOR THE X-RAY ASTROPHYSICS COMMUNITY, INCLUDING LABORATORY ASTROPHYSICISTS, OBSERVERS, AND MODELERS, OF ACCURATE AND ACCESSIBLE ATOMIC DATA. FOR MANY YEARS, FACTORS SUCH AS DISK SPACE AND COMPUTING POWER HAVE LIMITED THE AVAILABLE ATOMIC DATA, BUT RECENT ADVANCES MEAN THAT THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN RECEDING, AND WE EXPECT WITHIN THE FIRST YEAR OF THIS PROPOSAL TO HAVE AT LEAST ONE DATASET FOR EVERY PROCESS THAT COULD LEAD TO SIGNIFICANT EMISSION IN A COLLISIONAL PLASMA. THESE ADVANCES ALSO MEAN THAT A LONG-SOUGHT OBJECTIVE OF PROVIDING PRACTICAL UNCERTAINTIES TOGETHER WITH OUR MODEL CALCULATIONS CAN BE ADDRESSED. A NUMBER OF GROUPS, BOTH EXPERIMENTAL AND THEORETICAL, HAVE BEGUN TO PRODUCE DATA WITH ERRORS AND/OR SENSITIVITY ESTIMATES THAT CAN BE USED TO CREATE STATISTICALLY MEANINGFUL SPECTRAL ERRORS ON COLLISIONAL PLASMAS. ATOMDB HAS EXPANDED BEYOND PROVIDING JUST THE 'APEC' MODEL, AND NOW ALSO CONTAINS PHOTOIONIZATION DATA FROM XSTAR, AND A INITIAL CHARGE EXCHANGE MODEL ('ACX'). WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE TO (1) ENGAGE THE X-RAY ASTROPHYSICS COMMUNITY REGARDING ATOMIC DATABASE AND X-RAY SPECTROSCOPY ISSUES AND NEEDS, (2) CREATE NEW WEB TOOLS, APPS, AND CODE LIBRARIES AND ENHANCE EXISTING TOOLS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO ATOMDB, (3) ENLARGE ATOMDB TO INCORPORATE NEW TYPES OF ATOMIC DATA AND TO DEFINE NEW DATA FORMATS FOR THEM, INCLUDING HIGH-RESOLUTION ABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS SUITABLE FOR ASTRO-H, A COMPLETE SET OF DIELECTRONIC RECOMBINATION SATELLITE LINES, AND MEASURED AND CALCULATED CHARGE EXCHANGE CROSS SECTIONS, (4) CONTINUE TO UPDATE THE ATOMDB WITH THE LATEST CALCULATIONS AND LABORATORY MEASUREMENTS.
doc.MajorAgency: ATOMDB: ENHANCING AND EXPANDING AN ATOMIC DATABASE
doc.MajorFundingAgency: ATOMDB: ENHANCING AND EXPANDING AN ATOMIC DATABASE

INCREMENTAL FUNDING AMOUNT CHANGED: FROM $1,630,000.00 TO $1,693,000.00 AND TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO 9/30/2016. THIS IS A T&M TASK ORDER AND THE CONTRACTOR SHALL NOT INCUR ANY COSTS IN EXCESS OF THE FUNDED CEILING OF THE ORDER. IN THE EVENT THE FUNDED CEILING IS REACHED, WORK SHALL STOP AND CONTRACTING OFFICER SHALL BE NOTIFIED. TRAVEL SHALL BE BILLED AND REIMBURSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL TRAVEL REGULATION. TRAVEL SHALL NOT EXCEED THE CEILING AMOUNTS SET FORTH ON CLAUSES AND VENDOR'S QUOTE. INVOICE APPROVAL..JACKSON.RAPHAEL@EPA.GOV AND OR MCDONALD.JOSHUA@EPA.GOVRAPHAEL@EPA.GOV ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED.

OBJECTIVES: UNCOVER THE ROLES PLAYED BY MAGNETIC FIELDS IN THE FORMATION AND EVOLUTION OF MILKY WAY ANALOG GALAXIES, QUIESCENT GALACTIC CLOUDS, AND INFRARED DARK CLOUDS AND THE DENSE CLUMPS AND CORES WITHIN THEM. METHODS: TO ENHANCE ANALYSES OF EXISTING SPITZER, WISE, HERSCHEL, AND 2MASS PHOTOMETRIC STELLAR AND DIFFUSE EMISSION DATA, WE WILL ADD OUR RECENTLY COMPLETED GALACTIC PLANE INFRARED POLARIZATION SURVEY (GPIPS) DATA PRODUCTS. THESE OFFER UNIQUE INSIGHT INTO MAGNETIC FIELD PROPERTIES, THUS PERMITTING EXAMINING THE MAGNETIC PROPERTIES OF EDGE-ON GALAXIES AND NEARBY GALACTIC DUST CLOUDS. TOOLS WILL INCLUDE CHARACTERIZING THE PHYSICAL, GAS DYNAMIC, AND MAGNETIC FIELD PROPERTIES OF THREE DISTINCT SAMPLES OF OBJECTS AND TESTS FOR CORRELATIONS AND TRENDS CONNECTING THESE PROPERTIES. SIMULATED MOCK OBSERVATIONS WILL BE USED TO ASSESS PROJECTION EFFECTS AND OBSERVATIONAL BIASES TO INFORM CONFIDENCE ESTIMATES. SIGNIFICANCE: MAGNETIC FIELDS ARE DIFFICULT TO TRACE, YET SEEM TO PLAY VITAL ROLES IN PROVIDING ORDER AND REGULATION TO GALAXY, CLOUD, CLUMP/CORE, AND STAR/PLANET FORMATION PROCESSES. ACCURATE INTERPRETATION OF NASA PHOTOMETRIC AND RESOLVED EMISSION (AND ABSORPTION - I.E., INFRARED DARK CLOUDS) SURVEY DATA MUST INCLUDE UNDERSTANDING THE OTHERWISE HIDDEN MAGNETIC FIELD PROPERTIES AND ROLES. BY COMBINING GPIPS WITH EXISTING SPITZER, WISE, HERSCHEL, AND 2MASS DATA, QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENTS OF THE ROLES MAGNETIC FIELDS PLAY IN THE CLOUD AND STAR FORMATION PROCESS WILL TEST/REJECT COMPETING MODELS AND BETTER INFORM OUR UNDERSTANDING OF CLOUD AND STAR FORMATION PROCESSES IN GALAXIES THROUGHOUT THE UNIVERSE.
doc.MajorAgency: GALACTIC DUST CLOUDS, STAR FORMATION, AND MAGNETIC
doc.MajorFundingAgency: GALACTIC DUST CLOUDS, STAR FORMATION, AND MAGNETIC
